bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Alternative Names she shang sheng tai 舌上生胎.

Illness Sign of the appearance on the surface of the tongue of a thick fur-like coating. The character tai 胎 (lit.: “fetus”, “uterus”, “source”) in she tai 舌胎 is a near-homophone of what may have been the original character used to designate a fur-like coating: tai 苔 , lit. “moss”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry sheng jiang 生薑 quoting SHLS 3: 舌上 生胎，不拘滑白黃黑 , “When a coating develops on the tongue, regardless of whether it is smooth, white, yellow or black”, writes: 舌上生胎，諸病舌胎，以 布染井水抹，後用薑片時時擦之，自去 , “Fur-growth on the tongue, and all [other] types of diseases of tongue fur : Wipe [the tongue] with a piece of cloth moistened with well water, and then rub [the tongue surface] repeatedly with a piece of ginger”.
